AMERICAN FEDERATION OF RADIO ARTISTS
(Branch of Associated Actors and Artistes of America)
Affiliated with the American Federation of Labor
15 West 44th Street, New York 18, N. Y*
Telephone Vanderbilt 6 - 1810
A. Frank Reel
Natiohal
Executive Secretary
February 16, 1951
Mr. Charter Heslep
Chief, Radio-Television Branch
U. S. Atomic Energy Commission
Washington 25, D. C.
Dear Mr. Heslep:
In reply to your letter of February 12th, we normally do per¬
mit the use of recordings of radio programs without fee in
school systems and over non-commercial school broadcast facili¬
ties. However, we have never granted permission for such use
on a blanket basis. If you will notify us of the specific
school organizations and non-commercial school broadcast facili¬
ties that wish to use this program, we will be glad to give such
request our usual consideration. I can assure you that we have
and will continue to permit such reasonable use without payment
of additional fees in individual cases. We cannot, however, at
this time tell you that there may be indiscriminate use of such
recordings without our specific approval in the individual cases.
Sincerely,
AMERICAN FEDERATION OF RADIO ARTISTS
A. Frank Reel (signed)
A. FRANK REEL
NATIONAL EXECUTIVE SECRETARY
